text: Willem "Wim" Alfred Udenhout (29 September 1937 â€“ 22 May 2023)Wim Udenhout, former Suriname prime minister, dies at 85 was a Surinamese politician. He was the Prime Minister of Suriname from February 1984 to July 1986. He was a teacher and, for a time, and a Black Power activist. He was an ambassador to the United States. ==References== Category:1937 births Category:2023 deaths Category:Ambassadors to the United States Category:Prime Ministers of Suriname Category:Coronie District
title: Wim Udenhout
